name: COMMONWEALTH of Pennsylvania v. James TAYLOR, Appellant

judges: Before EAGEN, C. J., and O’BRIEN, ROBERTS, POMEROY, NIX, and MANDERINO, JJ.
parties: COMMONWEALTH of Pennsylvania v. James TAYLOR, Appellant.

opinions.text:
OPINION OF THE COURT
PER CURIAM.
Judgment of sentence affirmed. See Commonwealth v. Taylor, 473 Pa. 400, 374 A.2d 1274 (1977), which disposes of the same issues as those presented in the instant case, although with respect to a conviction for another criminal homicide.
opinions.author: PER CURIAM.

attorneys: Lester G. Nauhaus, John ft. Cook, Paulette J. Balogh, Asst. Pub. Defender, Pittsburgh, for appellant.
Robert E. Colville, Dist. Atty., Robert L. Eberhardt, Charles W. Johns, Asst. Dist. Attys., Pittsburgh, for appellee.
casebody.head_matter:
374 A.2d 1277
COMMONWEALTH of Pennsylvania v. James TAYLOR, Appellant.
Supreme Court of Pennsylvania.
Argued March 8, 1977.
Decided July 8, 1977.
Lester G. Nauhaus, John ft. Cook, Paulette J. Balogh, Asst. Pub. Defender, Pittsburgh, for appellant.
Robert E. Colville, Dist. Atty., Robert L. Eberhardt, Charles W. Johns, Asst. Dist. Attys., Pittsburgh, for appellee.
Before EAGEN, C. J., and O’BRIEN, ROBERTS, POMEROY, NIX, and MANDERINO, JJ.
